comments.body:
Can we make this as list of dict instead ? That way it will be more easier to access via `jq` or `json_query`.

For example - 

```
[
 {
  "esxi_hostname": "esx01.example.local",
  "changed: true,
  ...
 }
]
```

I'm not sure I understand the benefit of the list, I tend to prefer a dict, since it's easier to access a given key:

```result[host]['changed']```
I tend to agree with @goneri, a dict is nicer to work with.

@Akasurde @goneri I think we need to have a standard how VMware modules that configure all ESXi hosts of a cluster return their result. I'd prefer a dict with the ESXi hostname as a key (AFAIK there are several modules that do this), but could live with a list if I have to. The important thing is to have a standard.

How do we discuss this? IRC sucks because the three of us are seldom online at the same time. Email is too closed, other people should be able to join the discussion. But they wouldn't even know there __is__ a discussion if we only mail between each other. Any ideas?
